chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Adam Alex Tapia in court.  Attorney Mark P. Powers Aty in court for Adam Alex Tapia.  Attorney Alicia H Kort in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Case calendared for Scheduling Conference and Bail Hearing this date.  Defense requests adjournment as he needs forensic interview.  Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 34, Judge Yamahiro in Room 423 of the Safety Building.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  bm

Defendant Adam Alex Tapia in court.  Attorney Mark P. Powers Aty in court for Adam Alex Tapia.  Attorney Alicia H Kort in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense has received discovery, offer and requests adjourned scheduling conference/bail hearing.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  bm
Defendant's Motion for Modification of Bail received and filed.  bm

Defendant Adam Alex Tapia in court, appear by video with attorney Mark P. Powers, appear by video.  Student Intern Caroline Pellegrini with Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 12, Judge David Borowski. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial.  Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 12.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  bm

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Adam Alex Tapia in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Adam Alex Tapia in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
